docs.title: Tags
docs.text:
Tags are used to label, categorize, or organize information to make it easier to find, filter, or process. They provide metadata, add context, enable automation or specific behaviors, and support discovery and recommendations. They essentially make data more meaningful, structured, and actionable.

Tag Meaning CSO CSO-Internal Pages

docs.title: Banning players
docs.text: Banning players should never be done through your own scripts use Catweb's built-in banning functionality instead (introduced in Catweb v2.13.0.0)

docs.title: Tutorial
docs.text:
1. Go to your site's settings.

  2. Go to 'Access'

  1. Type the username or id1 of the user you want to ban.

  2. Press enter or return afterwards to add the player to the 'banlist'.

  1. Roblox User ID. Roblox Documentation ↩

docs.title: Naming Everything (Case)
docs.text: Author: TRCLoop (@trcloop) Idea and Definitions: Salad (@salad.txt) message

docs.title: Formats
docs.text: Naming Convention Example Description camelCase myVariableName First word lowercase, subsequent words capitalized for readability. snake_case my_variable_name All lowercase with underscores separating words. SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE MY_VARIABLE_NAME All uppercase with underscores, typically used for constants. PascalCase MyVariableName Each word starts with a capital letter.

docs.title: camelCase
docs.text: camelCase is a naming convention where the first word is lowercase and each subsequent word starts with a capital letter, improving readability (e.g., myVariableName).

docs.title: snake_case
docs.text: snake_case is a naming convention where words are written in lowercase and separated by underscores for clarity (e.g., my_variable_name).

docs.title: SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE
docs.text: SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE is a naming convention that's based on snake_case where all letters are uppercase and words are separated by underscores, typically used for constants (e.g., MY_VARIABLE_NAME).

docs.title: PascalCase
docs.text: PascalCase is a naming convention where each word starts with a capital letter and no separators are used, often for class names (e.g., MyVariableName).

docs.title: Variables
docs.text: Local (l!) and Object (o!) variables use camelCase or snake_case. Constant (Global) Variables use SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE.

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: Functions follow a similar pattern to variables, they use camelCase or snake_case

docs.title: Reason
docs.text: By standardizing the basic naming of everything, it's easy to see what is what. (eg. MAX_VALUE is surely a constant)
